--- title: "QALMRI" description: | How to read an article author: - name: Vadym Yudenko affiliation: American University Kyiv affiliation-url: https://auk.edu.ua/en/ date: 2023-11-01 toc-depth: 3 draft: true categories: - Reading - Research Methods --- When I was working on my thesis it was tough to figure out how to most efficiently work with relevant literature. My main question was how do various war experiences through their many manifestations affect individual time preferences? This is a pretty broad question, and I had to read a lot of literature to figure out how to narrow it down. One of the most useful things I learned was how to read an article. When you have found an interesting article. How do you read it? Do you try to understand every word and sentence? The languages employed in academic writing are often very complex and jargon-heavy! QALMRI addresses this issue by providing a framework for reading an article. It breaks down the process into five steps: ## Question What is the question the author is trying to answer? What is the main point of the article? What is the author trying to convince you of? Questions may be specific or broad. ::: {.callout-warning title="What plays the biggest role in winning TT?"}






::: ## Alternatives What alternative hypothesis does the athor consider? What alternative hypothesis can you think about? Critially assess the author's argument. What are the strengths and weaknesses of the author's argument? ## Logic "If X, then Y..." statements" ## Method How does author ## Results What do you make of the results? Are they what you expected? ## Inference What questions are left unanswered? What are the implications of the results? What are the limitations of the study? What are the next steps? Sources: https://www.crumplab.com/ResearchMethodsLab/qalmri.html
